page.title: 10TIN MINING (1)
page.content: Wheal Vor tin mine lies to the east of Tregonning Hill .In its heyday it was probably the largest and richest tin mine in Cornwall and probably in the whole world. The actual works consisted of several mines united in a complex which covered four square miles.The area was worked twice ,firstly,in the Eighteenth Century and then again when it was reopened by Captain John Gundry and his associates .Unfortunately ,they poured so much money into the venture that they became bankrupt.At this stage the Grylls solicitors in Helston saw the low cost of the mines shares and bought the mine.The Gundry family then sued the new firm and for thirty years a bitter law suit took place.
